pros: The Coworkers are great. Everyone is professional

job_title: Wellness Coordinator in San Antonio, TX

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: The people who actually live at the community are amazing. The community itself is beautiful.
cons: Senior Management is deplorable. They do NOT care about their employees. There will be a pretty picture painted for you at the very beginning like free employee meals, the work out facility etc...  but you will soon see that their leadership is HORRIBLE. From the top down there is a culture of nastiness. They do not care about their employees they will fire you or force you out on a whim.

job_title: Security Officer in San Antonio, TX
pros: Have not found one except some of the residents they are great and I miss them. The ones I knew.
cons: Working there it is best that you are a male in the good old boy system. I was belittled, put down and humiliated and and talked behind my back and  shoved at the end because, I knew more than my male co-worker. Then told that I couldn't handle my job. I went to my supervisor the first month I was there but, after that he did't want to hear it. When I tried to call him about the situation, he never picked up the phone.

job_title: Staff RN in San Antonio, TX
pros: location, benefit package, salary,scenery, free lunch. A chance to care for military veterans.
cons: No respect for professional nurses. Unrealistic expectations for nurses. Nursing orientation is lacking what you need to be successful. Administration is adversarial.

job_title: Sales and Marketing Associate in San Antonio, TX
pros: Very friendly place to work, staff and residents are amazing. Doesn't feel like work at all. Although I am only part-time, the team/staff makes me fell like a part of their team. Just love it!
cons: I haven't found any cons at this time.

pros: Laid back atmosphere and hard to get fired. Mostly great people to work with. Free meals, Christmas bonus. Good work/life balance.
cons: Management needs to own up to its responsibilities. Loyalty at times does not matter, but It matters if you are well liked.

review_title: It's great to feel appreciated at work again!
